meanings.definition: The action of attempting to explain or justify behavior or an attitude with logical reasons.
meanings.sent1: Her constant rationalization for being late was that traffic was always bad.
meanings.sent2: His rationalization for skipping class was that he needed to study for another test.
meanings.sent3: She had a funny rationalization for eating ice cream for breakfast - she claimed it helped her wake up faster.
meanings.sent4: His rationalization for buying the expensive shoes was that they would last longer than cheaper ones.
meanings.sent5: The politician's constant rationalization for his actions made it hard for people to trust him.

meanings.definition: The process of making something seem reasonable or acceptable by providing a rational explanation.
meanings.sent1: The company's rationalization for increasing prices was to improve the quality of their products.
meanings.sent2: Her rationalization of the budget cuts made sense to most of the team members.
meanings.sent3: The rationalization of having cake for dinner was that it had eggs and milk, so it counted as a meal.
meanings.sent4: The rationalization of the new policy was like putting lipstick on a pig - it still didn't make sense.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's rationalization of giving extra homework was that it would help students practice more.
